24:I[78891,["529","static/chunks/529-b3a318fab494e03f.js","244","static/chunks/244-f8e89f92ed6eb924.js","839","static/chunks/839-b514104c7e948606.js","165","static/chunks/165-ae3b45f0d86ef78d.js","184","static/chunks/app/dashboard/roots/%5Broot%5D/page-e0a9e2c37c8cb20d.js"],"CardTitle"]
25:T4dc,You who believe, when you contract a debt for a stated term, put it down in writing: have a scribe write it down justly between you. No scribe should refuse to write: let him write as God has taught him, let the debtor dictate, and let him fear God, his Lord, and not diminish &#91;the debt&#93; at all. If the debtor is feeble-minded, weak, or unable to dictate, then let his guardian dictate justly. Call in two men as witnesses. If two men are not there, then call one man and two women out of those you approve as witnesses, so that if one of the two women should forget the other can remind her. Let the witnesses not refuse when they are summoned. Do not disdain to write the debt down, be it small or large, along with the time it falls due: this way is more equitable in God&rsquo;s eyes, more reliable as testimony, and more likely to prevent doubts arising between you. But if the merchandise is there and you hand it over, there is no blame on you if you do not write it down. Have witnesses present whenever you trade with one another, and let no harm be done to either scribe or witness, for if you did cause them harm, it would be a crime on your part. Be mindful of God, and He will teach you: He has full knowledge of everything26:T4dc,You who believe, when you contract a debt for a stated term, put it down in writing: have a scribe write it down justly between you. Be mindful of God, and He will teach you: He has full knowledge of everything2e:T906,<entryFree id="n36629-6" key="إِكْتَتَبَ">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>8</itype>        
                     <orth lang="ar">إِكْتَتَبَ</orth>
                  </form> See 1.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">كِتْبَةٌ</foreign> [is a quasi-inf. n. of 8; <hi rend="ital">syn. with</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">إِكْتِتَابٌ</foreign>; and is explained as signifying] The <hi rend="ital">writing a book, transcribing it</hi> [<hi rend="ital">from another book</hi>]: (<foreign lang="ar">إِكْتِتَابُكَ كِتَابًا تَنْسَخُهُ</foreign>). (K.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  It also signifies, [as a quasi-inf. n. of 8,] The <hi rend="ital">writing one's name in</hi> [<hi rend="ital">the list of those who receive</hi>] <hi rend="ital">stipend and maintenance</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">الكتتاب فى</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الفرض والرزق</foreign> [<foreign lang="ar">اصحاب</foreign>]). (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">اكتتب</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He registered himself in the book of the Sultán's army-list,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stipendiaries.</hi> (S, K.) <foreign lang="ar">إِكْتَتَبْتُ فِى</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">غَزْوَةِ كَذَا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">I wrote down my name in the list of the soldiers of such an expedition.</hi> (TA, from a trad.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">اكتتب كِتَابًا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He asked for a book</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">the like</hi>) <hi rend="ital">to be written for him.</hi> (TA.)                   <form>       
                     <itype>3</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">مُكَاتَبَةٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n36627-1" target="تَكَاتُبٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> are syn.: (S, K:) you say, <foreign lang="ar">كاتب صَدِيقَهُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He wrote to his friend:</hi> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n36627-2" target="تكاتبا" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n36629"/></foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">They wrote, one to the other.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">كاتبهُ</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">مُكَاتَبَةٌ</foreign> (Az, K, Msb) and <foreign lang="ar">كِتَابٌ</foreign>, (Az, Msb,) <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">He</hi> (a slave) <hi rend="ital">made a written</hi> [or other] <hi rend="ital">contract with him</hi> (his master), <hi rend="ital">that he</hi> (the former) <hi rend="ital">should pay a certain sum as the price of himself, and on the payment thereof be free:</hi> (K, &amp;c.:) also <hi rend="ital">he</hi> (a master) <hi rend="ital">made such a contract with him</hi> (his slave): (Az, Msb, &amp;c.:) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n36627-3" target="تكاتبا" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n36629"/></foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">They two made such a contract, one with the other.</hi> (Msb.) The slave in this case is called <foreign lang="ar">مُكَاتَبٌ</foreign> (S, Msb) and also <foreign lang="ar">مُكَاتِبٌ</foreign>; and so is the master; the act being mutual. (Msb.) [But the lawyers in the present day call the slave <foreign lang="ar">مُكَاتَبٌ</foreign> only; and the master, <foreign lang="ar">مُكَاتِبٌ</foreign>.] <foreign lang="ar">الكِتَابَةُ</foreign>, signifying “ what is written, ” is tropically used by the professors of practical law as syn. with <foreign lang="ar">المُكَاتَبَةُ</foreign>, because the contract above mentioned was generally written; and is so used by them when nothing is written. It was thus called in the age of el-Islám, accord. to Az. These two words are said by Z to be syn.; but it is thought that he may have written the former by mistake for <foreign lang="ar">الكِتَابُ</foreign>, adding the <foreign lang="ar">ة</foreign> by a slip of the pen. (Msb.)    </entryFree>31:T674,<entryFree id="n36631" key="كُتْبَةٌ" type="main">

                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">كُتْبَةٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">A thong with which one sews</hi> (K) <hi rend="ital">a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">مَزَادَة</foreign> or <hi rend="ital">a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">قِرْبَة</foreign>: pl. <foreign lang="ar">كُتَبٌ</foreign>. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">That with which the vulva of a camel</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">of a mule,</hi> TA,) <hi rend="ital">is closed in order that she may not be covered:</hi> (K:) pl. <foreign lang="ar">كُتَبٌ</foreign>. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">A seam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suture,</hi> (KL, PS,) in a skin or hide; (KL;) [app. <hi rend="ital">made by sewing together two edges so that one laps over the other;</hi>] <hi rend="ital">a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">خُرْزَةٌ</foreign> (S, Mgh, K) <hi rend="ital">whereof the thong conjoins the two faces</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">sides</hi>]: (K:) or <hi rend="ital">a</hi>

                  <hi rend="ital">that is joined together with a thong:</hi> (Lth:) or <hi rend="ital">that whereof the thong conjoins each of the two faces</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">sides</hi>]: (ISd, TA:) pl. <foreign lang="ar">كُتَبٌ</foreign>.                   <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">كِتَابٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> [inf. n. of 1, q. v.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  as a subst.,] <hi rend="ital">A thing in which,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on which, one writes:</hi> [<hi rend="ital">a book:</hi>] <hi rend="ital">a written piece of paper</hi> or [<hi rend="ital">a record,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">register;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a written mandate;</hi>] <hi rend="ital">of skin:</hi> (K:) <hi rend="ital">a writing,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">writ,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing written;</hi> as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n36634-1" target="كَتِيبَةٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n36637"/></foreign>: and both are applied also to the <hi rend="ital">revelation from above:</hi> and to <hi rend="ital">a letter,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">epistle, which a person writes and sends:</hi> sometimes made fem., as meaning <foreign lang="ar">صَحِيفَةٌ</foreign>: AA says, I heard an Arab of the desert, of El-Yemen, say, <foreign lang="ar">فُلَانٌ لَغُوبٌ جَآءَتْهُ كِتَابِى فَٱحْتَقَرَهَا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Such a one is stupid: my letter came to him, and he despised it:</hi> so I said, Dost thou say, <foreign lang="ar">جاءته</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">كتابى</foreign>? and he replied, Is it not a <foreign lang="ar">صحيفة</foreign>? (Msb.) Pl. <foreign lang="ar">كُتُبٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">كُتْبٌ</foreign>. (S.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">A revealed scripture.</hi> (Msb.) [Whence <foreign lang="ar">أَهْلُ كِتَابٍ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">People having a revealed scripture:</hi> and <foreign lang="ar">أَهْلُ الكِتَابِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The people of the Bible.</hi> See also <foreign lang="ar">أَهْلٌ</foreign>.] <foreign lang="ar">الكتاب</foreign> signifies <hi rend="ital">The</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">تَوْراة</foreign>, or <hi rend="ital">Pentateuch,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Mosaic Law:</hi> (K:) and <hi rend="ital">the Gospel,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Book of the Gospels: the Scriptures of the Jews and Christians:</hi> (Expositions of the Kur, passim:) and <hi rend="ital">the Kur-án.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  See also 3.       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">كِتَابٌ</foreign> [inf. n., or subst.: see 1] <hi rend="ital">Divine prescript, appointment,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ordinance: judgment,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sentence: fatal decree,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">predestination.</hi> (S, K.) <foreign lang="ar">لَأَقْضِيَنَّ بَيْنَكُمَا بِكِتَابِ اللّٰهِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">I will assuredly determine,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">judge, between you two according to the judgment,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sentence, of God, which hath</hi> 
                  <pb n="2591"/> 
                  <hi rend="ital">been revealed in his book.</hi> A trad., not relating to the Kur-án. (TA.) El-Jaadee says, <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">يَا ٱبْنَةَ عَمِّى كِتَابُ اللّٰهِ أَخْرَجَنِى</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">عَنْكُمْ وَهَلْ أَمْنَفَنَّ اللّٰهَ مَا فَعَلَا</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [<hi rend="ital">O daughter of my paternal uncle! the decree of God hath expelled me from you: and could I indeed forbid God to do what He hath done?</hi>] (S.) [Hence,] <foreign lang="ar">الكِتَابُ الأَوَّلُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The first writing;</hi> meaning <hi rend="ital">the register of God's decrees</hi>].                   <hi rend="ital">A skin that is sewed</hi> (S) <hi rend="ital">with two thongs:</hi> (TA:) and the same, and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n36635-1" target="مُكْتَبٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n36641"/></foreign>, (S,) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n36635-2" target="مُكْتَتَبٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n36645"/></foreign>, (TA,) <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">A skin bound with a</hi>

                  <foreign lang="ar">وِكَاء</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">so that nothing</hi> [<hi rend="ital">of its contents</hi>] <hi rend="ital">may drop from it.</hi> (TA.)    </entryFree>34:T4fd,<entryFree id="n36640" key="مَكْتَبٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">مَكْتَبٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> (S, K) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n36640-1" target="كُتَّابٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n36638"/></foreign> (Lth, S, &amp;c.) <hi rend="ital">A school; a place where the art of writing is taught:</hi> (S, K, &amp;c.:) accord. to Mbr and F, the assigning this signification to the latter word is an error; it being a pl. of <foreign lang="ar">كَاتِبٌ</foreign>, and signifying, accord. to Mbr, the <hi rend="ital">boys of a school:</hi> in the A it is said, this word is said to signify the boys; not the place: but Esh-Shiháb says, in the Sharh esh-Shifa, that it occurs in this sense in the classical language, and is not to be regarded as a postclassical word: it is said to be originally a pl. of <foreign lang="ar">كَاتِبٌ</foreign>, and to be fig. employed to signify a school. (TA.) Pl. of the former <foreign lang="ar">مَكَاتِبُ</foreign>; (TA;) and of the latter <foreign lang="ar">كَتَاتِيبُ</foreign>. &#91;believers&#93; are permitted to lie with your wives during the night of the fast: they are &#91;close&#93; as garments to you, as you are to them. God was aware that you were betraying yourselves, so He turned to you in mercy and pardoned you: now you can lie with them- seek what God has ordained for you- eat and drink until the white thread of dawn becomes distinct from the black. Then fast until nightfall. Do not lie with them during the nights of your devotional retreat in the mosques: these are the bounds set by God, so do not go near them.
